DOC.brief_summary: The long term goal study entitle `` Quit & Fit '' revise , evaluate , disseminate American Lung Association´s ( ALA ) teen smoke cessation program call Not On Tobacco ( N—O—T ) , add physical activity module . The physical activity module intend encourage youth adopt physically active lifestyle . Research show physical activity may increase odds smoke cessation . The general N—O—T program goal help adolescent quit smoking ; reduce cigarette use ( participant unable completely quit ) ; increase healthy lifestyle behavior ; improve life skill stress management , decision making , communication , interpersonal skill . The primary aim current research project reduce smoking among West Virginia teen . A two—prong secondary aim ( ) increase participants´ physical activity behavior supplement intervention physical activity component ( b ) ass mediating/moderating impact physical activity cessation outcomes . If participant quit smoking , likelihood develop smoking—related disease diminish . Participating project may aid smoke cessation therefore improve participants´ health . Research conduct among 19 123 West Virginia public high school . 236 teen recruit participate study 3 year . This study clinical behavioral trial use 3-group design , subsequent random assignment .
